Hi, there! Anything new? I am struggling with compile tvm with anaconda environment.
Please open a discuss forum issue for support questions at discuss.tvm.ai.

typo: TESORFLOW -> TensorFlow. 
Pls fix CI, the issue segfault issue of test_vm.test_sum_loop is an intermittent error, will be fixed with pr 3299 I guess
I suggest that @tqchen also takes a look at how profile information is retrieved

ci_2: All checks have passed

ci_1: `test_vm.test_sum_loop ... ./tests/scripts/task_python_integration.sh: line 41: 31003 Segmentation fault      (core dumped) TVM_FFI=ctypes python3 -m nose -v tests/python/relay`

This branch is up again

Is this caused by F.broadcast_mul in last second line in hybrid_forward()? There's some related topic.[autotvm-nnvm-error-when-extract-task-from-graph-with-opt-level-3](https://discuss.tvm.ai/t/autotvm-nnvm-error-when-extract-task-from-graph-with-opt-level-3/810/5)

please rebase against the current master
@jroesch please manage this PR
Hey, this change is absolutely correct. Just to confirm, is this used for building conda-forge packages?
LGTM, thanks

I'll see about the conflict here

edit: Looks like a very easy fix, will attend to soon

got another failed build
http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-3350/4/pipeline
LGTM! Could you resolve the conflicts and do the merge?

@slyubomirsky Can you approve it in addition to saying LGTM?

@MarisaKirisame @icemelon9 @zhiics @slyubomirsky Can it be merged ASAP? I'm constantly getting `test_sum_loop Segmentation fault` errors https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/issues/3352
Experienced the same with `test_count_loop()`, fyi

Most of the recent builds failed with `Segmentation fault`:
http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-3347/8/pipeline
http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-3344/2/pipeline
http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-3356/2/pipeline
http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-3342/2/pipeline
@tqchen We have serious problem in CI
#3299 seems to have fixed the segfaults, at least on my end
yes. I think it should fix the problem.
@ZihengJiang rebased. I don't have the permission to merge. Could you or @jroesch merge it? Thanks.
@FrozenGene Can you have a look?

@jroesch I don't have a strong argument on adding new static tensor allocation. But I don't see adding this new instruction will cause any overhead either. I suggest that we can have this static alloc instruction for now, and later change it to alloc tensor from storage. I can also reserve an opcode for alloc storage instruction. What do you think?

I'll add examples of instruction printer.

Updated instruction printer outputs:
Move: `move $2 $1`
Return: `ret $3`
Alloc tensor: `alloc_tensor $1 [1, 3, 224, 224] float32`
Alloc tensor with regisger: `alloc_tensor_reg $2 $1 float32`
Alloc datatype: `alloc_data $3 tag(0) [$1, $2]`
Alloc closure: `alloc_closure $4 VMFunc[3]($1, $2)`
Load const: `load_const $1 Const[1]`
Get field: `get_field $2 $1[2]`
Invoke VM function: `invoke $4 VMFunc[4]($1, $2, $3)`
Invoke packed function: `invoked_packed PackedFunc[1](in: $1, $2, out: $3, $4)`
Invoke closure: `invoke_closure $4 $1($2, $3)`
If: `if $2 0 10`
Goto: `goto 2`
Select: `select $4 $1 $2 $3`

Hey @junrushao1994 , yes, it would be good to have it, otherwise, I will have to patch the CMakeLists.txt, usually, in conda-forge we try to avoid third paties packages which are shipped along with the project. As I mentioned before, I already packaged those dependencies which tvm needs.

> typo: TESORFLOW -> TensorFlow.
> Pls fix CI, the issue segfault issue of test_vm.test_sum_loop is an intermittent error, will be fixed with pr 3299 I guess

Do I need to merge pr 3299? @yongwww
I have updated this PR. Here are some of the alternative names in my mind: `CanonicalizeCast`, `CanonicalizeFusion`.
@kevinthesun can you add me to the slack channel? I requested on TVM discuss https://discuss.tvm.ai/t/request-for-invite-to-the-slack-channel/2888 3 days ago, but I haven't gotten a response yet.
cc @icemelon9
https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/issues/3358
Thanks, @FrozenGene @apivovarov , this PR is now merged
BTW, what’s the status of current tvm/conda directory (https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/tree/master/conda)? Isn’t that suppose to be working properly with conda-forge?
Thanks, @zhiics @ZihengJiang @jroesch , this PR is now merged
any updates on this PR?
@zhiics please rebase against the latest master
@zhiics I hope to push this change asap, can you please rebase and work on it? We need to update the python side as well(and update the testcases)
@yongwww please check the ci error https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/pull/3270
CanonicalizeCast seems to be a good name, @jroesch what do you think about it

> > typo: TESORFLOW -> TensorFlow.

It was merged yesterday, the issue should be gone once you rebase your change
I'll fix it today.

> BTW, what’s the status of current tvm/conda directory (https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/tree/master/conda)? Isn’t that suppose to be working properly with conda-forge?

Not with conda-forge, but it might help, because conda-forge has their own structure to build the package, usually the users just have to write a recipe and our infrastructure should do the rest

@tqchen sorry. I got really busy recently. I will rebase and push the work I have so far today. I planed to only remove the pass.h and some small passes from python side in this PR , and remove most python ir_pass.xx in a follow-up because I am afraid that it may break things.
Don't merge this, I discovered some problems in the resulting packages.  I'll fix those problems and add some automated testing of the resulting packages.
Thanks, @yongwww @FrozenGene @huajsj , this PR is merged
For the case of android apps, we should use the pragmatic way to config the number of threads, rather than macros,
In particular, we can do that via PackedFunc https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/blob/master/src/runtime/thread_pool.cc#L362
Please open a new thread on  https://discuss.tvm.ai
``` tvm.rpc.server.start``` is an optional callback, perhaps a better name should be  ```tvm.rpc.server.on_start```

http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/rest/organizations/jenkins/pipelines/tvm/branches/PR-3362/runs/1/nodes/36/log/?start=0

This flaky test happens again
They work. I think it's a bit redundant to test all combination. So I just remove some.
@tqchen  CI issue was fixed.
Thanks, @yongwww this PR is now merged.
Thanks, @derisavi @sgrechanik-h @wweic @Hzfengsy . this PR is now merged. Let us address the remaining comments in the subsequent PRs
@tqchen Thanks for your advice. I'll close this.
Thanks ,@marcelotrevisani @junrushao1994 this PR is now merged
Let us use https://discuss.tvm.ai/ for this kind of design questions, as the issue is not really actionable and cannot be closed in a definite amount of time
this thread is concluded and we shall move layout transformation as passes in relay
closed for now, likely we can get related support in https://github.com/pytorch/tvm thanks to @bwasti
https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/pull/3010
What is the status of this issue? We might want to fix promptly or mark as inactive and close it
https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/pull/2038
Please conclude and summarize the RFC so we could start a vote about the text format
closed in favor of the most recent chisel RFC
Looks good, I think we should have a release/debug split potentially for devs which flips a bunch of useful debugging flags on by default, changes opt-level, etc. We can do in follow up work.

@tqchen @FrozenGene @jackwish 

I have added a prototype patch. I think it will be helpful to use that patch to drive the discussion further.

@tqchen @FrozenGene @jackwish @yzhliu @eqy @ZihengJiang @vinx13 
Your reviews will be very helpful :)
Thanks @icemelon9 please close the corresponding flaky issues
Fixed in #3362
@FrozenGene @yongwww Could you have a look?
PR to support `RESIZE_BILLINEAR` https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/pull/3370

> @tqchen @FrozenGene @jackwish @yzhliu @eqy @ZihengJiang @vinx13
> Your reviews will be very helpful :)

Thank you for ping @anijain2305 and glad to see this draft.
Personally, I'd like comment only on *generic* quantization stuff such as algorithms, arithmetics (and ecosystems maybe), but not TVM stack things, so not much from me currently. :)

> Personally, I'd like comment only on _generic_ quantization stuff such as algorithms, arithmetics (and ecosystems maybe), but not TVM stack things, so not much from me currently. :)

Thanks @jackwish 
I am pretty sure that we will need your expertise as soon as we have a TVM stack setup in a decent manner :) I will ping you once we have that

@anijain2305 see the code quickly and I know your thought (combine operator to complete q_conv2d). However as commented before, how do we integrate with qnnpack when we don't have output_min / output_max? I think we could have these two arguments, if mxnet don't have, we could leave them the default values.

@yzhliu @jroesch @zhiics @icemelon9 @tqchen @kevinthesun have incorporated comments except for the scalar representation. I tried to add scalar support in my [own branch](https://github.com/yongwww/tvm/tree/size).  But failed to run on graph runtime since the schedule was mutated in Halide improperly.  Filed [an issue](https://discuss.tvm.ai/t/return-scalar-value-for-some-ops/2939).
Is it possible to add a regression test for this?
We still have to setup CI, for these. Is that what you are referring to?
Sure, if it is straightforward, you can just check in a simple python script to test. Otherwise we can merge when this passes.

Currently, there are regression tests for the two language backends of the example see [Chisel test](https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/blob/bc9bffd6e7a3afff54d5ff5bed0616fee5df383b/vta/apps/tsim_example/tests/python/chisel_accel.py) and [Verilog test](https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/blob/bc9bffd6e7a3afff54d5ff5bed0616fee5df383b/vta/apps/tsim_example/tests/python/verilog_accel.py)

The problem was that the bug was not triggered when I ran these on a Linux because the upper 32-bit were luckily always zero when I tested. This was not the case on OSx. This was the buggy [line](https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/blob/bc9bffd6e7a3afff54d5ff5bed0616fee5df383b/vta/apps/tsim_example/hardware/chisel/src/main/scala/accel/RegFile.scala#L56).

> > Do I need to merge pr 3299? @yongwww

done.
@FrozenGene Can you have a look?

Frontend GPU test group failed
http://ci.tvm.ai:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/tvm/detail/PR-3370/1/pipeline
Error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/workspace/python/tvm/relay/frontend/tflite.py", line 235, in _convert_resize
    from tflite.ResizeNearestNeighborOptions import ResizeNearestNeighborOptions
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tflite.ResizeNearestNeighborOptions'
```

It means that Jenkins worker still uses old tflite flatbuffers schema from Tensorflow 1.12
Recently I updated `ubuntu_install_tflite.sh` to use schema from version 1.13
https://github.com/dmlc/tvm/blob/master/docker/install/ubuntu_install_tflite.sh#L38
It was merged 16 hours ago

### Schema v 1.13
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/r1.13/tensorflow/lite/schema/schema.fbs
